" you get what you pay " most time cliche true , but there products out there break this rule . philips dvp642 one them , great quality , versatile product selling bargain price . this not . i hoping same this product all " glowing " reviews here . however , this quality this monopod very disappointing . first all , you ask yourself , why you need monopod over tripod ? myself most , it because we need some stability portability our telephoto zoom lenses . however , telephoto zooms long heavy so monopod should designed strong solid live up task . this monopod doesn't even come close . here it bad points : -the aluminum construction very cheap quality . leg segments wobble laterally when you extend close them . it feels like thin , cheap aluminum monopod feels it could break half like toothpick any time . -the head very cheap not solid . no matter how tight i tightened head , my camera would slope down . workmanship head so cheap any point , you think you're going break plastic tightening screw if you tighten it too much . i think we've all experienced past . -the leg locks not tight . when you push down monopod , leg segments slide back into themselves . end , it risk i took hoping i could get high-quality product cheap price . sometimes , you get away . walmart sells very decent functioning tripod only $30 . this case , i should've bought real monopod . oh well , i wasted $16 i could've used help pay higher quality monopod

i this camera since jan ' 05 so far taken approximately 10,000 shots while trips weddings . don't expect much it you happy . entry level dslr it what it supposed ideal conditions . i find it strength taking people photographs bright light , provided they not moving . cons : landscape photography this camera lacking - both due inadequate megapixels it inability capture natural blues greens very well . battery dies fast . battery i got it hardly lasts whole day shooting , especially when shooting raw mode . i yet fill up 1gig card when shooting raw mode(approx 150 shots ) before battery dies . surprisingly when shooting jpegs , i get more shots per charge(over 300 ) but hardly enough last day . i cannot tell you number times battery died me while i out hike . so i always carry backup film camera ( my trusty elan 7 ) . viewfinder very dim . when i look through my elan 7 then through 300d , it painfully obvious how dark image through 300d viewfinder . indoor situations low light this becomes handicap , especially when resort manual focus . autofocus low light 300d terrible . when shooting indoors , autofocus hunts ends up focusing something behind your intended subject . i lots beautiful photos walls sconces background sharp focus while people standing front middle frame out focus blur . this despite 420ex flash my camera uses infrared beam assist focus . 420ex flash supposed " talk " camera adjust power order ensure subjects not over or under exposed . however , 300d , this crap shoot best many my indoor shots over/under exposed . after five months , shutter button started sticking . i would click it then it would remain depressed . shutter button would only pop back up after i jiggled it little . annoying thing camera settings displayed rear camera not top beside shutter button . since there only one thumbwheel , it not easy change aperature shutter speed . example , if you use thumbwheel change aperature , then change shutter speed you would press button while same time turning thumbwheel . when you take thousands shots over life camera , this real annoyance . so would i recommend this camera : if you casual point shoot person , it affordable entry into dslrs produces decent photos . but if you plan shooting lot indoors or want take landscape photographs actually convey colors accurately , look elsewhere

these my experiences extender mounted my eos 10d . i'm currently debating whether or not buy it my new 30d , but it looks like i don't want risk wasting my money . let me explain : let me start saying only reason i gave this 2 stars instead 1 because it prevent my nose smudging lcd screen . i shoot events nightclubs lot , so i'm always ( ) running around get shots , causing me sweat , which causes sweaty oily nose tip ( ) i always show subjects their photos after i take them , so smudgy screen kind annoying . further clarification , i'm asian , so my nose not defined or long other ethnicities . i run around lot when i shoot . so constant activity eventually led extender naturally fall off . i got lucky once , found it general vicinity where i , but second time , i wasn't so lucky . so what i ? i purchased one . not only i purchase extender , i purchase viewfinder replacement ( piece soft rubber ) because attached lost extender . 2 weeks , again , same problem . i didn't even bother buying any replacements , this time , i upgraded 30d . if you don't plan doing lot running around , then this piece may okay you . however , please take into consideration this piece also fell off me while putting my camera back my canon backpack . some reason , piece didn't fit tightly mount camera . problem , most people mentioned , images very noticeably smaller through this extender , so prepared strained eyes if you plan using your camera all day . i guess i'll check it out my local camera shop see how it fits 30d ; i'll sure write review if results different than 10d

( i also emailed them same request ) . neither my wishes ever fulfilled canon behalf . itself enough me i've bitter ever since . i've also told every person i've met who wanted buy digital camera this incident . i'm pleased say , i've steered most away this company . what else i say this camera : this camera slow times after its taken picture . i've missed out some good shots due this . it eats batteries like there no tomorrow so one must rechargeable aa even make this camera worth its while . i've not used other digital cameras so maybe they all this way but if i take 3 minute movie ( this camera ) my home during day go outside , most things outside very white . almost like looking infra red photograph . when filming outside , when one goes inside during day , everything dark . like i said , maybe all digital cameras this way ? i wouldn't recommend this camera or anything canon makes if you want my personal opinion . think . you pay shipping camera that barely few months old still under warranty . that disgusting , that all i say . there should zero this , not 1 star

me-1 provides modest 1.2 magnification viewfinders olympus e-300 e-500 cameras . ideally , this would allow sharper manual focusing more precise framing . unfortunately , this not happen when i used me-1 make number trial images my e-500 , so i returning me-1 refund . ( record , i wear prescription eyeglasses while shooting , my " shooting eye " corrected 20/20 vision . ) like other folks , i find e-500 viewfinder trifle small so it not always easy frame shot see exposure data same time . camera must also pressed against your face when framing , which not always comfortable . some ways , me-1 created more problems than it solved . me-1 kept camera further my face ( though it seemed bump harder against my glasses ) , but cost * narrowing * my angle vision viewfinder . divide viewfinder into four equal columns rows so you eight squares . four squares middle viewfinder easily visible , but those sides , top , bottom * less * visible than before , corners considerably less . frame shot , i move my eye around viewfinder much more me-1 than without it . see exposure data , i shift my eye almost completely away image . more hassle than i need when shooting field . fortunately , there option works me . e-300 e-500 come ep-5 eyecup , which definitely too small my taste . but larger eyecup also available , ep-6 . ep-6 keeps camera little further my face . viewfinder diopter properly adjusted ( critical step no one seems mention ) , ep-6 allows me see both entire image exposure data without shifting my eye very much all . all this vary person person , course , there may circumstances when me-1 exactly what needed -- so two rather than one star . but not standard shooting conditions , especially if you need compose , set exposure , shoot quickly

( if you're switching film digital , some your lenses may may no longer fit your needs focvf . your 35 mm lens no longer really wide angle 45 mm . ) 3 . durability . this most important me , though it may not someone who doesn't shoot extreme conditions or expects replace their camera two years . both 1ds 1d sport complete metal bodies , sealed against weather shutter last least 200,000 cycles . 5d - very solid camera - designed 100 , 000 , not weather sealed more plastic components . 4 . weight/size . what solid , metal body giveth durability it taketh away weight . those who prefer camera heft , these it . many people , this big drawback . 1ds 1d 43 oz ., or almost three pounds just body , without big battery . add battery you're 54 oz . 5d just 29 oz . 31 oz . battery . 1ds 1d , built-in vertical grips , also more than 2 inches taller . if you're looking something less obtrusive easier carry around , 5d it . 5 . speed . there reason 1d camera choice photojournalists , sports many bird photographers . it shoots smooth 8.5 frames per second , compared 4 fps 1ds 3 fps 5d . most day-to-day uses , 3 fps more than adequate . using both , i'd say 1d autofocuses bit faster , too . 1d 45 autofocus points , compared nine 5d . 6 . price . give or take hundred here or there , 1ds $ 7,200 ; 1d $ 3,900 ; 5d $ 3,000 . price determine whether you get 1ds or not . if you afford it , go it . otherwise , other features - or possiblity buying more lenses instead more camera - make your decision . what i decide ? first , i looked how i'd use camera : photojournalism , travel wildlife photography . higher fps not important me durability autofocus speed , so either 1d or 1ds would . end , i decided i'd rather spend money lenses would not obsolete next new improved camera . this uv filter it job protect lens well . build solid ( metal construction ) . glass also descent quality . performance , it absorbs some uv light . uv light absorbtion hardly noticeable , probably sky 1-a haze filter version absorb more uv light than this lens which fine me . now , one problem which internal reflection . i've heard many people say it mostly happens during night or low light shooting . i found out it not caused directly low light/night situation . internal reflection appear when there strong/bright source light comparison overall exposure ( surrounding environment ) . put it example ( which hopefully easier understand ) , when you take picture lamp during nightime light much brighter than surrounding area then you see internal reflection . you move position light closer sides/corner picture ( not center picture ) , internal reflection reduces finally dissapear ( if you move light far enough center ) . if light isn't too bright/contrast compare surrounding environment then there no internal reflection . but course most time , lamp nightime often very bright . but point i'm trying make internal reflection doesn't happen all time during low light or night time . additionally , internal reflection isn't only happening night . it also happen afternoon if you taking picture sun example . basically same rule above , how bright light source compared surrounding area , you move sun center photo near side internal reflection move side/dissapear ( also depending angle ) . but best way just remove filter during these situations . hope this explanation helps you reduce occurence internal reflection identifying correctly when internal reflection occur then remove filter during those situation ( which not hard ) . i'm actually not fan lens filter ( any filter ) i think it only degrade picture quality we added layer sensor object , but i decided use them anyway all my lens . i would recommend everyone get one this filter if you don't any filter your lens .

just clarify few other differences gs500 gs300 besides those mentioned review below . gs500 indeed offer additional mp still shots ( 4.0 mp ) 12x zoom , but that not all ... it also bigger longer lens , 1/ 4.7 " ccd ( 1070k 3 pixels ) sensors instead 1/6 " ccd ( 800k 3 pixels ) gs300 . filter diameter 43mm instead 37mm . gs500 aperture range 1.6 f16 opposed gs300 1.8 f16 . this all may not make huge difference , but optics technically bit better gs500 , low light ability rated more sensitive too -- minimum 5 lux vs . 12 lux gs300 . gs500 also offers manual focus ring lens ( gs300 " manual , " but it operated through lcd menu/joystick ) , actual hot ( opposed cold gs300 ) shoe mounted accessories such lights or microphones . gs500 procinema shooting mode , designed give widescreen footage " film " appearance . gs300 doesn't . gs500 not automatic lens cap gs300 -- toss up auto bit more convenient , but more noisey . gs500 also real door memory card instead rubber cover over port gs300 . panasonic lists weights gs500 3.17 lbs vs . 2.98 gs300 -- hardly big difference . finally , there also " freestyle " remote addition regular remote gs500 -- this plug remote useful when camera tripod , doesn't come gs300 . course both models no longer available retailers , but these days price difference used models more like $250-300 , so consider well ... despite all i've said , i ended up getting gs300 myself . unfortunately , panasonic 3ccd dv camcorders decline since gs400/250 , currently there no successor gs500 only gs320 currently left panasonic 3ccd/mini dv category . gs320 loses few key features gs300 ( like external mic ) , doesn't touch gs500 . perhaps panasonic get clue introduce good hd mini dv camera one day ..

this uv filter it job protect lens well . build solid ( metal construction ) . glass also descent quality . performance , it absorbs some uv light . uv light absorbtion hardly noticeable , probably sky 1-a haze filter version absorb more uv light than this lens which fine me . now , one problem which internal reflection . i've heard many people say it mostly happens during night or low light shooting . i found out it not caused directly low light/night situation . internal reflection appear when there strong/bright source light comparison overall exposure ( surrounding environment ) . put it example ( which hopefully easier understand ) , when you take picture lamp during nightime light much brighter than surrounding area then you see internal reflection . you move position light closer sides/corner picture ( not center picture ) , internal reflection reduces finally dissapear ( if you move light far enough center ) . if light isn't too bright/contrast compare surrounding environment then there no internal reflection . but course most time , lamp nightime often very bright . but point i'm trying make internal reflection doesn't happen all time during low light or night time . additionally , internal reflection isn't only happening night . it also happen afternoon if you taking picture sun example . basically same rule above , how bright light source compared surrounding area , you move sun center photo near side internal reflection move side/dissapear ( also depending angle ) . but best way just remove filter during these situations . hope this explanation helps you reduce occurence internal reflection identifying correctly when internal reflection occur then remove filter during those situation ( which not hard ) . i'm actually not fan lens filter ( any filter ) i think it only degrade picture quality we added layer sensor object , but i decided use them anyway all my lens . i would recommend everyone get one this filter if you don't any filter your lens yet .
